story:
As-salamu alaykum, dear son! It's time for our special bedtime story. Gather close and listen well, for I have a tale of magic and wonder to enchant your dreams.

Once upon a time, in the golden city of Baghdad, there lived a young boy named Ali. Ali was a curious and adventurous soul, with eyes as bright as the stars and a heart full of wonder. He lived in a cozy little house with his parents, a wise and kind mother who told him stories of the ancient ones, and a father who was a skilled rug weaver, creating beautiful patterns on the intricate tiles of their home.

One evening, as the full moon rose high in the sky, Ali stumbled upon a mysterious amulet hidden away in his father's workshop. The amulet glowed with a soft, ethereal light, and as Ali touched it, he felt an odd sensation, as if the magic of the world was awakening within him.

The next morning, Ali awoke to find that the city was bathed in a soft, pale light. The air was filled with the sweet scent of rosewater and orange blossoms, and the sounds of the call to prayer drifted on the breeze. As he looked around, Ali saw that the city was transformed – the streets were quiet and empty, and the only signs of life were the birds singing in the trees.

Following the amulet's glow, Ali discovered that he was holding the key to unlocking the secrets of the city. He found himself led to a hidden garden, where ancient trees bore fruit that shone like lanterns in the night. Ali plucked a particularly radiant pomegranate, and as he bit into its juicy flesh, he felt his senses expand, as if he could see and hear the world anew.

As he wandered through the garden, Ali encountered a wise old man, dressed in white robes, who introduced himself as the Keeper of the Secret Garden. The old man told Ali that he had been chosen to fulfill an important task – to spread the magic of the city to all its inhabitants.

Together, Ali and the old man set out on a journey, spreading the amulet's glow throughout the city. As they walked, Ali discovered that the magic was already within him, and with his newfound abilities, he healed the sick, fed the hungry, and quenched the thirst of the thirsty. The people of Baghdad noticed a change in the air, and soon, the city was abuzz with joy and wonder.

The next day, as the sun set over the Tigris River, Ali returned to his parents, who had been searching for him everywhere. His mother and father were overjoyed to see their brave son, and they welcomed him back with open arms. From that day on, Ali and the old man continued to spread the city's magic, and the people of Baghdad lived in harmony and peace, blessed by the kindness and generosity of their young hero.

And so, my dear son, remember that the magic of the world is within you, waiting to be uncovered. May you always remember Ali's story and the power of kindness, compassion, and wonder. May the stars guide you on your journey and the scent of orange blossoms fill your dreams. Goodnight, my child, and may Allah's blessings be upon you.
